alert.note: Alert for Tehama (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 2:04PM PDT until March 16 at 10:04AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Near Hamilton City affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. Sacramento River Below Red Bluff Diversion Dam affecting Tehama County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River At Ord Ferry affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. Sacramento River At Vina Woodson Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Tehama Bridge affecting Tehama County. .Heavy rainfall from the past 24 hours continues to produce significant rises on the Upper Sacramento river system. Flood wave has reached Vina Woodson Bridge on the Sacramento River and will continue to move downstream. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Hamilton City, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sacramento River at Tehama Bridge. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 206.7 feet, Water into rv park on east side of river. Tires of trailers get wet. At 209.7 feet, Flood stage - Road inside trailer park and turn around site under RR tracks (Tehama/Vina road) become impassible. Water is into area around structures on east side of river. No structural damage. Sheriff`s office issues advisory. Makes sure Pelhams Bay, Snug Harbor, River Inn (small trailer parks all in a row on east side of river north of bridge) know of advisory. At 210.7 feet, Between 210 and 211 feet the county park becomes inaccessible. At 211 feet water begins to enter Driftwood RV fishing resort on east bank of river and just north of the county park. At 214.7 feet, Pelams Resort access road floods. At 215.0 feet, Low lying area on west side of river south of the town of Tehama floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 215.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM PDT Wednesday was 215.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 203.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 209.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 214.9 feet on 03/06/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM PDT.
